info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL STILLWATER... NORTHWESTERN CARBON...SOUTHWESTERN YELLOWSTONE AND CENTRAL SWEET GRASS COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Absarokee, or 19 miles southwest of Columbus, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Laurel, Joliet, Absarokee, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Edgar, Fishtail, Park City, Rockvale, Boyd, Dean, and Silesia. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
